item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Sepolia Incident Update 📣
We've identified and deployed a fix for the Sepolia deposit contract issue found earlier today. This issue was cause by Sepolia's custom permissioned contract, which is different than mainnet.
All node operators must upgrade their nodes to the versions listed in this blog post: https://blog.ethereum.org/2025/03/05/sepolia-pectra-incident
Validators have already upgraded and the chain is now operating normally. It's possible that some explorers, wallets, or other infrastructure providers have issues until they also upgrade their nodes.
item.dc:creator: @TimBeiko
item.description:
Sepolia Incident Update 📣

We've identified and deployed a fix for the Sepolia deposit contract issue found earlier today. This issue was cause by Sepolia's custom permissioned contract, which is different than mainnet.

All node operators must upgrade their nodes to the versions listed in this blog post: blog.ethereum.org/2025/03/05…

Validators have already upgraded and the chain is now operating normally. It's possible that some explorers, wallets, or other infrastructure providers have issues until they also upgrade their nodes.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Imo the most easily observable difference between a good crypto lawyer and a TardFi reject grifting crypto is getting them to talk about what the law should be.
Every good crypto lawyer I know also has a view on policy. Bad ones don’t care bc it’s a short term play for them.
item.dc:creator: @wassielawyer
item.description:
Imo the most easily observable difference between a good crypto lawyer and a TardFi reject grifting crypto is getting them to talk about what the law should be.

Every good crypto lawyer I know also has a view on policy. Bad ones don’t care bc it’s a short term play for them.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: I'm STARK-maxi for Bitcoin Scaling, since 2013. Which is why I'm op_cat favorable (but not maxi) Which is also why I'm op_* favorable Which si why I'm op_{ctv,csfs, gsr, arithmetic} maxi
I'm anti-ossification. Ossification -> centralization.
item.dc:creator: @EliBenSasson
item.description:
I'm STARK-maxi for Bitcoin Scaling, since 2013.
Which is why I'm op_cat favorable (but not maxi)
Which is also why I'm op_* favorable
Which si why I'm op_{ctv,csfs, gsr, arithmetic} maxi

I'm anti-ossification. Ossification -> centralization.

item.title:
Zama and Starkware are by far the most serious companies in cryptography.
I hope we can continue working with the two for the decades to come. They are smarter than us and we like to learn from people that know what they are doing.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: When in crisis, print the money. Germany amended its constitution practically overnight to green light borrowing money for defence. Let this be instructive on how govts will choose to finance the new world order whatever it ends up looking like.
item.dc:creator: @CryptoHayes
item.description: When in crisis, print the money. Germany amended its constitution practically overnight to green light borrowing money for defence. Let this be instructive on how govts will choose to finance the new world order whatever it ends up looking like.

item.title:
Short term crypto will do badly.
Long term every country will print too much. Bitcoin, Ethereum and gold.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern

item.title: A big relevant part of the industry is @ethereum. Not having anybody from Ethereum is a huge mistake.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
A big relevant part of the industry is @ethereum. Not having anybody from Ethereum is a huge mistake.

nitter.freedit.eu/Austin_Federa/status/1897077340452348084#m

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: hey @DavidSacks
@dannyryan is a former Ethereum core developer who led Ethereum through its most complex transition in its history, moving it from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake
he is cofounder of a new organization called @Etherealize_io, designed to help introduce the world to building on Ethereum as the #2 public blockchain by market cap and a leader in decentralized programmable blockchains
Danny would make an excellent representative for Ethereum and can help you not only brainstorm, but think through in deep technical detail how to architect systems which bring the US government and private businesses onchain
please consider adding him to the invite list for this and future Digital Asset Summits
item.dc:creator: @iamDCinvestor
item.description:
hey @DavidSacks

@dannyryan is a former Ethereum core developer who led Ethereum through its most complex transition in its history, moving it from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake

he is cofounder of a new organization called @Etherealize_io, designed to help introduce the world to building on Ethereum as the #2 public blockchain by market cap and a leader in decentralized programmable blockchains

Danny would make an excellent representative for Ethereum and can help you not only brainstorm, but think through in deep technical detail how to architect systems which bring the US government and private businesses onchain

please consider adding him to the invite list for this and future Digital Asset Summits
